Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
A
pmath::ExprA wrapper for pmath_t and drived types.

This class wraps a single pmath_t, so its size is sizeof(void*)

pmath::GatherUtility class for emitting and gathering expressions/building lists

Gathering begins with the construction of the object and ends with a call to end() or the object destruction

pmath_binary_file_api_tAccess functions for binary files
pmath_cstr_writer_info_tAdditional information for pmath_utf8_writer() or pmath_native_writer()
pmath_custom_tThe Custom Object class
pmath_expr_tThe Expression class
pmath_float_tThe Floating Point Number class
pmath_hashtable_tThe Hashtable class
pmath_integer_tThe Integer class
pmath_messages_tA message queue for interthread communication
pmath_number_tThe abstract Number class
pmath_quotient_tThe Quotient class
pmath_rational_tThe abstract Rational Number class
pmath_span_array_tInternal flat representaion of spans
pmath_span_tRepresents a span in a span-array
pmath_stack_tThe type of pMath's threadsafe stacks
pmath_string_tThe string class
pmath_symbol_tThe Symbol class
pmath_tThe basic type of all pMath objects
pmath_text_file_api_tAccess functions for text files
pmath_thread_tThe Representation of a thread
pmath_threadlock_tA reentrant lock for threads
pmath::StringA wrapper for pmath_string_t.

This class provides some string utility functions in addition to Expr
